meanings.definition: A medical imaging technique that uses sound waves to create images of internal body structures.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used echographs to see inside the patient's body.
meanings.sent2: The echographs showed a clear picture of the heart.
meanings.sent3: The echographs revealed a surprise party inside the stomach!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an echograph, capturing every detail of the memory.
meanings.sent5: The echographs painted a vivid picture of the unborn baby.

meanings.sent1: The echographs displayed detailed images of the baby.
meanings.sent2: She marveled at the clarity of the echographs.
meanings.sent3: The echographs played a game of hide-and-seek with the doctor.
meanings.sent4: His words were like echographs, revealing the truth hidden within.
meanings.sent5: The echographs etched a lasting memory in her mind.

meanings.sent1: The technician will echograph the patient's heart tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to echograph the organs accurately.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to echograph the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent4: His words echograph the emotions of the characters in the story.
meanings.sent5: The photographer will echograph the stunning landscape at sunset.
